subject: Climate & Environment
title: Soil Erosion After Clearing
description: A short lesson to help you apply Soil Erosion After Clearing.

hook.text: Topsoil is only about 15 centimeters deep. Forests hold it in place with their roots.

buildup.text: Remove the trees and rain washes the soil downhill in sheets and mudslides.

discovery.text: Haiti lost 98% of its forest cover. Floods there are now devastating because soil can't absorb rain.

twist.text: It takes 500 to 1,000 years to form one inch of topsoil. Erosion removes it in one storm.

climax.text: Without soil, cleared land becomes barren â€” unable to support forest, farms, or life.

punchline.text: Kill the forest and the land dies next.

quiz.question: How long does it take to form one inch of topsoil?
